poem:
The Sheepfold Awaits  
  
In the Corsican valley,  
morning light braids with the aroma  
of rosemary and thyme.  
A sheepfold, now restful, cradles dreams,  
while shutters open to the orchestra  
of winds through olive groves.  
Each terrace whispers the secret of stone,  
where guests savor the tender music,  
a symphony of soil and sun.
